name: Vecchia Firenze

reviews.title: What a great B&B!!!
reviews.text: I must preface my review by this statement - hotel class in Italy is not the same as in the US! We stayed at mainly 2 to 3 star hotel/B&B, and they are not what you will find in the US! Nothing luxurious, just very basic. Most of the time, none of the furniture matched and looked old. However, everything was always clean and more importantly, no bugs either!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyways, we stayed at the B&B for 3 nights during a 2 week trip throughout Italy. This small B&B was a good deal by Italian standards. The room was huge compared to other B&B was stayed at, and we shared a double room with four adults. The rate was 150 Euros/night or 130 Euros/night if we paid in cash. Needless to say, we paid in cash!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Florence

likes.liked: — It felt like my very own apartment in Florence
likes.disliked: — A little noisy at night in the square outside, but fine with earplugs.

reviews.text: The location of this place is great. It's in Altrarno, or a part of Florence that is south of the river Arno. It's convenient because it's close enough to all the sights (usually 15-20 walk), but then far enough away to get away from all the tourists! After long days of sightseeing, we loved coming back to the Santo Spirito square where the B&B was to just hang out and drink Cava! On the square itself, there are a couple of cute restaurants and a little convenience store where we would always buys snacks and liquor.
reviews.title: great b and b

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have a funny story as well. We randomly ran into a few people we knew from our hometown of Chicago on S. Spirito square eating at the pizza place directly below to B&B! It was such a coincidence because we knew that we would be travelling to Italy around the same time. We asked them what they were doing in the area, and they said that they were told to come to S. Spirito just to really get a good feel of what normal life is like in Florence for a typical Italian person! They were staying close to the train station and were really disappointed with not only the hotel, but also at how expensive it was.
reviews.title: Gorgeous!

likes.disliked: — Bit of noise from the square

reviews.text: The only negative was that this place is a bit of a hike from the train station. We walked and it took us about 25 minutes, and it was difficult rolling around our luggage on the cobblestone streets. I was very tired, but my mood brightened when I saw the lovely farmers market that was set up on the square! Also, I should tell you that late at night, there were a few shady individuals to watch out for. We consistently saw the same drug pusher every night. This is a common thing in Italy, so don't let it disuade you. He never approached us, and seemed relatively harmless. We are from Chicago, so it didn't really bother us. Also, you will hear Vespas all night long, but this is also something that you cannot get away from in Italy!
reviews.title: Charming B & B

description: The B&B "Vecchia Firenze" (Olde Florence), newly constructed and equipped with lift, is located on the third floor within an old building from the 1500s. It looks onto one of the most beautiful squares in Florence which is full of old artisan and antique shops that render characteristic and charming the quarter named San Frediano.
